4 /** \file
5  * The simplifier is separated into multiple compilation units with
6  * this single shared header to speed up the build. This file is not
7  * exported in Halide.h. */
8

14 // Because this file is only included by the simplify methods and
15 // doesn't go into Halide.h, we're free to use any old names for our
16 // macros.
17 
18 #define LOG_EXPR_MUTATIONS 0
19 #define LOG_STMT_MUTATIONS 0
20 
21 // On old compilers, some visitors would use large stack frames,
22 // because they use expression templates that generate large numbers
23 // of temporary objects when they are built and matched against. If we
24 // wrap the expressions that imply lots of temporaries in a lambda, we
25 // can get these large frames out of the recursive path.
26 #define EVAL_IN_LAMBDA(x) (([&]() HALIDE_NEVER_INLINE { return (x); })())
27 
28 namespace Halide {
29 namespace Internal {
30 
31 class Simplify : public VariadicVisitor<Simplify, Expr, Stmt> {
32  using Super = VariadicVisitor<Simplify, Expr, Stmt>;
33 
34 public:
35  Simplify(bool r, const Scope<Interval> *bi, const Scope<ModulusRemainder> *ai);
36 
37  struct ExprInfo {
38  // We track constant integer bounds when they exist
39  int64_t min = 0, max = 0;
40  bool min_defined = false, max_defined = false;
41  // And the alignment of integer variables
42  ModulusRemainder alignment;
43 
44  void trim_bounds_using_alignment() {
45  if (alignment.modulus == 0) {
46  min_defined = max_defined = true;
47  min = max = alignment.remainder;
48  } else if (alignment.modulus > 1) {
49  if (min_defined) {
50  int64_t new_min = min - mod_imp(min, alignment.modulus) + alignment.remainder;
51  if (new_min < min) {
52  new_min += alignment.modulus;
53  }
54  min = new_min;
55  }
56  if (max_defined) {
57  int64_t new_max = max - mod_imp(max, alignment.modulus) + alignment.remainder;
58  if (new_max > max) {
59  new_max -= alignment.modulus;
60  }
61  max = new_max;
62  }
63  }
64 
65  if (min_defined && max_defined && min == max) {
66  alignment.modulus = 0;
67  alignment.remainder = min;
68  }
69  }
70 
71  // Mix in existing knowledge about this Expr
72  void intersect(const ExprInfo &other) {
73  if (min_defined && other.min_defined) {
74  min = std::max(min, other.min);
75  } else if (other.min_defined) {
76  min_defined = true;
77  min = other.min;
78  }
79 
80  if (max_defined && other.max_defined) {
81  max = std::min(max, other.max);
82  } else if (other.max_defined) {
83  max_defined = true;
84  max = other.max;
85  }
86 
87  alignment = ModulusRemainder::intersect(alignment, other.alignment);
88 
89  trim_bounds_using_alignment();
90  }
91  };
92 
93 #if (LOG_EXPR_MUTATORIONS || LOG_STMT_MUTATIONS)
94  static int debug_indent;
95 #endif
96 
97 #if LOG_EXPR_MUTATIONS
98  Expr mutate(const Expr &e, ExprInfo *b) {
99  const std::string spaces(debug_indent, ' ');
100  debug(1) << spaces << "Simplifying Expr: " << e << "\n";
101  debug_indent++;
102  Expr new_e = Super::dispatch(e, b);
103  debug_indent--;
104  if (!new_e.same_as(e)) {
105  debug(1)
106  << spaces << "Before: " << e << "\n"
107  << spaces << "After: " << new_e << "\n";
108  }
109  internal_assert(e.type() == new_e.type());
110  return new_e;
111  }
112 
113 #else
114  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
115  Expr mutate(const Expr &e, ExprInfo *b) {
116  // This gets inlined into every call to mutate, so do not add any code here.
117  return Super::dispatch(e, b);
118  }
119 #endif
120 
121 #if LOG_STMT_MUTATIONS
122  Stmt mutate(const Stmt &s) {
123  const std::string spaces(debug_indent, ' ');
124  debug(1) << spaces << "Simplifying Stmt: " << s << "\n";
125  debug_indent++;
126  Stmt new_s = Super::dispatch(s);
127  debug_indent--;
128  if (!new_s.same_as(s)) {
129  debug(1)
130  << spaces << "Before: " << s << "\n"
131  << spaces << "After: " << new_s << "\n";
132  }
133  return new_s;
134  }
135 #else
136  Stmt mutate(const Stmt &s) {
137  return Super::dispatch(s);
138  }
139 #endif
140 
141  bool remove_dead_lets;
142  bool no_float_simplify;
143 
144  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
145  bool may_simplify(const Type &t) const {
146  return !no_float_simplify || !t.is_float();
147  }
148 
149  // Returns true iff t is an integral type where overflow is undefined
150  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
151  bool no_overflow_int(Type t) {
152  return t.is_int() && t.bits() >= 32;
153  }
154 
155  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
156  bool no_overflow_scalar_int(Type t) {
157  return t.is_scalar() && no_overflow_int(t);
158  }
159 
160  // Returns true iff t does not have a well defined overflow behavior.
161  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
162  bool no_overflow(Type t) {
163  return t.is_float() || no_overflow_int(t);
164  }
165 
166  struct VarInfo {
167  Expr replacement;
168  int old_uses, new_uses;
169  };
170 
171  // Tracked for all let vars
172  Scope<VarInfo> var_info;
173 
174  // Only tracked for integer let vars
175  Scope<ExprInfo> bounds_and_alignment_info;
176 
177  // Symbols used by rewrite rules
178  IRMatcher::Wild<0> x;
179  IRMatcher::Wild<1> y;
180  IRMatcher::Wild<2> z;
181  IRMatcher::Wild<3> w;
182  IRMatcher::Wild<4> u;
183  IRMatcher::Wild<5> v;
184  IRMatcher::WildConst<0> c0;
185  IRMatcher::WildConst<1> c1;
186  IRMatcher::WildConst<2> c2;
187  IRMatcher::WildConst<3> c3;
188  IRMatcher::WildConst<4> c4;
189  IRMatcher::WildConst<5> c5;
190 
191  // Tracks whether or not we're inside a vector loop. Certain
192  // transformations are not a good idea if the code is to be
193  // vectorized.
194  bool in_vector_loop = false;
195 
196  // If we encounter a reference to a buffer (a Load, Store, Call,
197  // or Provide), there's an implicit dependence on some associated
198  // symbols.
199  void found_buffer_reference(const std::string &name, size_t dimensions = 0);
200 
201  // Wrappers for as_const_foo that are more convenient to use in
202  // the large chains of conditions in the visit methods below.
203  bool const_float(const Expr &e, double *f);
204  bool const_int(const Expr &e, int64_t *i);
205  bool const_uint(const Expr &e, uint64_t *u);
206 
207  // Put the args to a commutative op in a canonical order
208  HALIDE_ALWAYS_INLINE
209  bool should_commute(const Expr &a, const Expr &b) {
210  if (a.node_type() < b.node_type()) {
211  return true;
212  }
213  if (a.node_type() > b.node_type()) {
214  return false;
215  }
216 
217  if (a.node_type() == IRNodeType::Variable) {
218  const Variable *va = a.as<Variable>();
219  const Variable *vb = b.as<Variable>();
220  return va->name.compare(vb->name) > 0;
221  }
222 
223  return false;
224  }
225 
226  std::set<Expr, IRDeepCompare> truths, falsehoods;

228  struct ScopedFact {
229  Simplify *simplify;
230 
231  std::vector<const Variable *> pop_list;
232  std::vector<const Variable *> bounds_pop_list;
233  std::vector<Expr> truths, falsehoods;
234 
235  void learn_false(const Expr &fact);
236  void learn_true(const Expr &fact);
237  void learn_upper_bound(const Variable *v, int64_t val);
238  void learn_lower_bound(const Variable *v, int64_t val);
239 
240  ScopedFact(Simplify *s)
241  : simplify(s) {
242  }
243  ~ScopedFact();
244 
245  // allow move but not copy
246  ScopedFact(const ScopedFact &that) = delete;
247  ScopedFact(ScopedFact &&that) = default;
248  };
249 
250  // Tell the simplifier to learn from and exploit a boolean
251  // condition, over the lifetime of the returned object.
252  ScopedFact scoped_truth(const Expr &fact) {
253  ScopedFact f(this);
254  f.learn_true(fact);
255  return f;
256  }
257 
258  // Tell the simplifier to assume a boolean condition is false over
259  // the lifetime of the returned object.
260  ScopedFact scoped_falsehood(const Expr &fact) {
261  ScopedFact f(this);
262  f.learn_false(fact);
263  return f;
264  }
